Package ohos.rpc

Class MessageOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.rpc.MessageOption

  • public class MessageOption
extends Object
    Defines options for sending messages together with sendRequest.
    Since:
    1

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int TF_ACCEPT_FDS
      Indicates that file descriptors can be returned for the sendRequest interface.
      static int TF_ASYNC
      Indicates that the sendRequest interface is called in asynchronous mode.
      static int TF_SYNC
      Indicates that the sendRequest interface is called in synchronous mode.
      static int TF_WAIT_TIME
      Indicates that wait seconds of sync call.

        public MessageOption​()
        Constructs a default MessageOption object.

        The default MessageOption object uses synchronous messaging.

      • MessageOption

        public MessageOption​(int flags)
        Constructs a specified MessageOption object using the flag specified in flags.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the flag to use for creating the object, TF_SYNC for synchronous call and TF_ASYNC for asynchronous call.
        Since:
        1

      • MessageOption

        public MessageOption​(int flags,
                     int waitTime)
        Constructs a specified MessageOption object using the flag specified in flags.
        Parameters:
        flags - Indicates the flag to use for creating the object, TF_SYNC for synchronous call and TF_ASYNC for asynchronous call.
        waitTime - Indicates TF_WAIT_TIME for synchronous call wait seconds to use for creating the object.
        Since:
        4

        Returns the synchronous or asynchronous messaging flag of the MessageOption object.
        Since:
        1

      • setWaitTime

        public void setWaitTime​(int waitTime)
        Sets the time to wait before determining a request timeout.

        This method is usually used to set a long wait time when the writeRawData method is called to send a large volume of data in cross-device communications. After the wait time expires, the sender deems that the request has timed out. The default wait time is TF_WAIT_TIME.

        When setting the wait time, you should consider the time consumed when the receiver returns a large volume of data by calling the writeRawData method.

        Permissions: ohos.permission.DISTRIBUTED_DATASYNC

        Parameters:
        waitTime - Indicates the wait time to set.
        Since:
        4

      • getWaitTime

        public int getWaitTime​()
        Obtains the wait time.

        After the wait time expires, the sender deems that the request has timed out.

        Permissions: ohos.permission.DISTRIBUTED_DATASYNC

        Returns:
        Returns the wait time.
        Since:
        4
